tweets.text:
Yesterday #TeamEA were at St Johns Beck in #Carlisle with volunteers to plant trees as part of the ¬£3.9 Million Riparian Tree Planting Fund 

Find out more https://t.co/KmjxenZib5 https://t.co/yhDPItsPHS

Shocked and appalled at this damage to a protected wildlife site. The River Lugg is home to many threatened invertebrates. We hope that @NaturalEngland and @EnvAgency take appropriate action to ensure the site is restored, and protected for the future
https://t.co/ZLI76RRJAt

Perhaps most interesting about the devastation on the River Lugg is that the landowner purported to be responsible had recently had an application for 19 homes on his land refused. One of the key points for refusal was the site‚Äôs proximity to the River...üò° https://t.co/4uiVVMGH3C https://t.co/jYrltg1dA8

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW
@owenboswarva @EnvAgency Good work; thank you. Also fascinating - I've been able to put dates - and in one case a name - to local reservoirs. I'll be adding the details to Wikipedia tomorrow.

Thank you to all the @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm staff out on site working together to take action on reported damage at the #RiverLugg. Stop notices served and an investigation underway. https://t.co/moayq4k5aR

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Please take action on this. Send a message to others that they will not be able to get away with it. Just slapping a fine on a rich landowner will not make a dent. We're depending on you, so please do this properly, publically and to the full extent of the law.

@Ruttingbuckone @work_home_play @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Is there any suggestion that the EA was in the pocket of the developer?  Individual officers bank accounts should be opened to scrutiny

tweets.text:
Trees are vital in protecting our rivers.  

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre putting ¬£1.4 million towards funding 15 community projects to plant more trees near rivers and streams.  

Read: https://t.co/Gf0f3pgLNY  
 
#PlantMoreTrees #NationalTreeWeek #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/9ILpU5ivbX

Foggy by the River Cam #Cambridge. There are Otters on the stretch just downstream from here, & a half eaten Bream I found on the bank along this part suggests they come up here too. https://t.co/NgKsqe2Ywp

We‚Äôve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox

Trees deserve to be enjoyed by everyone üå≤üå≥ 
 
That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre giving ¬£3.9 million to #PlantMoreTrees outside of woodlands, in our cities, towns and rivers. 

Watch our video to find out more üëá 

‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/PuTzpXtAj9  

@EnvAgency #NationalTreeWeek #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/wNYqkfX3PK

After five brilliant years I leave my job leading flood in #TeamEA - but I don‚Äôt go far- from today I‚Äôm our Exec Director of Operations working with our frontline teams on all EA activities water, biodiversity, regulating industry and of course floods! tweets.text:
BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

@MilesKing10 @loosecollie The Farming Forum thread has over 12 pages of almost unanimous support for the work. I seem to be in a minority of farmers who believe rivers aren‚Äôt just large drainage ditches for farmland.

tweets.text: @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Can you comment on the meeting between the Parish council and the EA officials who assigned the work of remodelling the bank to the landowner in October?

@kate_suttle @PeterReavill @TheMontyDon @HfdsCouncil @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA @Jesse_Norman @BillWigginMP Yes - it's so frustrating that protection and enforcement roles have been outsourced, weakened, fragmented and underfunded, and damage often only comes to light when it's too late.  Let's hope meaningful penalties are used here, and serve as a deterrent.

tweets.text:
This is interesting. Lots of chat on online farming forums that the farmer did nothing wrong and the river Lugg needed cleaning up/out. That's now percolating on here. 

All I can say is if you want the public on your side, think about what image of farming you're projecting. https://t.co/WodYyJe2cT

@kate_suttle @PeterReavill @TheMontyDon @HfdsCouncil @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA @Jesse_Norman @BillWigginMP Do you believe that a landowner thinking he can get away with this is proof that no-one of these organisations care?
